title: dApp Templates & GUI dApp Modules
description: Learning new code language is a barrier for Dev's, give them the ready-made code & info', how to customise quickly for common use-cases

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seems very vague. It asking for $72k to build some templates and code modules and databases of developers. One of the claims is that language barriers can be over come by providing simple code blocks and then a developer can be hired to do anything harder. If so what is this really providing?
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is quite vague of what will actually be delivered. This seems more like a salesman's document than a clear proposal of a project with details of what will be built. This just doesn't pass the smell test for me. No references of existing sources of information are provided or explanations as to why this would be better. 
"23 Years online starting with a book on HTML in 1998" is all that is claimed as experience.
f6_assessments.q2: Whilst there is a road map, the deliverables aren't very specific. It wouldn't be hard to post some simple modules to a github repo and build a simple web page with a directory of developers and claim to have met the deliverables. There should be some goals and metrics tracking the impact the provision of the services developed here have on the developer ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: Not really a proposal; more like a list of ideas. Some are good ideas but lacking depth.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no explanation of what is this team that would be working on these. It sounds like the developers are yet to be recruited.
f6_assessments.q2: This could be a great proposal for Fund7 if you can find more people to validate your ideas, to make the plan more concrete and to showcase a team who is going to implement it.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of a templating generating module will be a plus for the ecosystem , especially the beginners and the impact will be enormous. I am concern with the solution provided , it seem more of suggestion that will fit into the "Insight" stage of the challenge. I don't see any feasibility of the Proposal from the current solution provided.  The proposer mention the creation of  a foundation framework for a customisable platform. That to me , seem the proposed solution is in Layers which is more complex. I recognise that the core idea of creating a templating module will be beneficial to the ADA holders but I think the way the solution is provided does not effectively address how this is possible , for that I am neutral
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer said in the roadmap that "This project is ready for immediate development, available to the public within 2 months" i believe 2 month is too short to build a template generation tool given that proposer require contractors and seek to work with others in the Cardano space to  develop the foundation of the project. It seem the two month mention will be for team building only.  There is a budget breakdown in the proposal but most of the item might need to further breakdown , for example, the item websites, can be improve to be more specific and the type type of website needed. The road map also seem like objectives not a clear road map on how to solve the problem. for the i score 2
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal lack  no clear KPI/metric  , no start date, no sufficient Information to aid the progress audit of this Proposal , For a proposal of this nature , I would have expected the proposer to mention numbers of pull request or github commit per week/month , for that i score 2

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seeks to develop templates to simplify creating applications for the Cardano blockchain which is within the challenge settings and would have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. However, the proposed solution remains very vague. No detailed description of any template is given. Therefore the real impact of this proposal remains unclear.
f6_assessments.q1: The great weakness of this Proposal is that no exact plan or structure of the promised templates is explained. Without any technical details, it is impossible to say whether this proposal is worth implementing. Some parts is even written in the subjunctive, as if the plan is not yet clear. Also there are no direct link to relevant references or at least a mock up etc. The budget includes elements that are not mentioned in the proposal (website, translation, etc.). Why is the website more expensive than the templates? Just a little explanation about that would help to better understand the budget. In order to get a better score, the proposer has to present more details (as described). Based on the provided information a successfully implementation is not clear.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap laid out but without clear deliverables it is not helpful for auditing. There is no documentation provided so that the community can observe the progress of this project. The goal of 5000 developers without giving any context (where do they come from? What is your go-to-market strategy for becoming a primary source for developers?) is not a helpful KPI as well. As I mentioned, this proposal misses many important information, not only about the solution but also here about auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: There are already similar projects with much more competent background underway, so another that expendive project in this area cannot be justified to run on catalyst funds.
f6_assessments.q1: While the plan is set up in a mostly detailed and correct manner, for several reasons, after some research the company does not seem up to the task. 1) The website and the social media does not match up to the self-acclaimed reputation and claimed size of the company (all media and social media coverage is selfmade, the wensite looks very unprofessional for someone who supposedly has been in the business for 23 years and the website discloses nothing about any staff member while there are apparently about 10 CH companies). Furthermore, taking a look into the UK business registry the company or versions of it was dissolved and re-found several times. The sheer amount of proposals from the proposer make it unlikely that he will be up to the task of finishing all of these. 2) Strike off requests from the company have been suspended or denied, which often means outstanding debt.
f6_assessments.q2: While milestones are set, some of the targets are defined very open. Furthermore, the fact that the company was already dissolved several times in the recent year make ot unlikely that the proposal can be audited. How can you audit a proposer who regularily dissolves his business?
f6_assessments.reply:
Dear vCA,
Only a personal opinion given: The assessor has decided they know the capabilities of the proposer based on a quick scan of social media and a misunderstanding about the status of the company, they have made a blanket judgement of all ten proposals based on incorrect judgements. There is no debt because the company has never traded, all assessments are copied and pasted on each of my proposals showing a general bias against all of my proposals.
Unconstructive assessment: The UK Companies are all in good order, this assessor does not understand UK company law, the companies have not been dissolved even once, Notices were served to dissolve the company one time, when I thought about discontinuing the project but I decided to continue and filed the necessary document to continue the company. This does not indicate a lack of ability to complete the proposal.
Regards,
Carl Henry

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal meets the goal of attracting more developers to the Cardano ecosystem in several ways. The barriers to entry into the ecosystem are reduced through best practices and templates. At the same time, the developer contracting platform will provide potential developers with opportunities to leverage and monetize their knowledge of the Cardano development ecosystem. This offers people around the world the opportunity to make a living by developing dApps, smart contracts and other extensions.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is very interesting but also very extensive. Since the proposal includes several subareas (platform, templates, translation, marketing, tokenomics), there is a risk to get lost in the amount of tasks. Here it is important to have a good enough team that can be divided between the different areas. The coordination effort here should not be underestimated. If these points can be fulfilled, the chances of a successful implementation are given.
f6_assessments.q2: Due to the roadmap which is divided into 3 stages (3 months, 6 months, 1 year), the progress of this proposal can be followed well. Since this is a large project, the level of detail of the roadmap could be a bit more granular.

f6_assessments.q0: Lots of excellent ideas to bring in new talent of non Haskell developers and to grow the developer base and make life easier for them.
f6_assessments.q1: The direction and plan of a developer  site like Fiverr would add a lot of value to the ecosystem for sure. Other ideas are also sound and have enough high level detail (sic)
f6_assessments.q2: This is an area of improvement (imho) but I understand there can be improvements made here before finalisation? Some milestones in terms of what can be delivered and chunked as well as having some timeline breakpoints are needed.

solution: GUI environments allowing modular building of apps using standardised code, to customise quickly & directory of Dev contractors for hire
experience: 23 Years online starting with a book on HTML in 1998
